doc.question: Which of the following is incorrect with respect to diary of proceedings in investigation as per the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
doc.correct_answer: Can be used by the police officers to refresh memory.
doc.option_a: a) The statements of witnesses recorded during investigation shall be inserted in the diary.
doc.option_b: b) The diary shall be duly paginated.
doc.option_c: c) The diary may be used as evidence.
doc.option_d: d) Can be used by the police officers to refresh memory.

arguments:
Question: Which of the following is incorrect with respect to diary of proceedings in investigation as per the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
A. a) The statements of witnesses recorded during investigation shall be inserted in the diary.
B. b) The diary shall be duly paginated.
C. c) The diary may be used as evidence.
D. d) Can be used by the police officers to refresh memory.
Answer:

doc.question: In which of the following cases manner of committing offence is not required to be mentioned in the charge as per the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
doc.correct_answer: A is accused of the theft of a certain article at a certain time and place.
doc.option_a: a) A is accused of the theft of a certain article at a certain time and place.
doc.option_b: b) A is accused of cheating B at a given time and place.
doc.option_c: c) A is accused of disobeying a direction of the law with intent to save B from punishment.
doc.option_d: d) A is accused of giving false evidence at a given time and place.

arguments:
Question: In which of the following cases manner of committing offence is not required to be mentioned in the charge as per the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
A. a) A is accused of the theft of a certain article at a certain time and place.
B. b) A is accused of cheating B at a given time and place.
C. c) A is accused of disobeying a direction of the law with intent to save B from punishment.
D. d) A is accused of giving false evidence at a given time and place.
Answer:

doc.question: Which of the following offences may be tried summarily as per the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
doc.correct_answer: Offence punishable with imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.
doc.option_a: a) Offence under Section 454 of the IPC.
doc.option_b: b) Offence under Section 504 of the IPC.
doc.option_c: c) Offence punishable with imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.
doc.option_d: d) Offence punishable with life imprisonment.

arguments:
Question: Which of the following offences may be tried summarily as per the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973?
A. a) Offence under Section 454 of the IPC.
B. b) Offence under Section 504 of the IPC.
C. c) Offence punishable with imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.
D. d) Offence punishable with life imprisonment.
Answer:

doc.question: Which of the following Section of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 provides for reference to High Court?

arguments:
Question: Which of the following Section of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 provides for reference to High Court?
A. a) Section 275
B. b) Section 325
C. c) Section 383
D. d) Section 395
Answer:

doc.question: A person accused of the following offence may not be granted bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973: 'i) Accused of offence under Section 376AB of the IPC.', 'ii) Accused of offence under Section 376DA of the IPC.', 'iii) Accused of offence under Section 376DB of the IPC.'

arguments:
Question: A person accused of the following offence may not be granted bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973: 'i) Accused of offence under Section 376AB of the IPC.', 'ii) Accused of offence under Section 376DA of the IPC.', 'iii) Accused of offence under Section 376DB of the IPC.'
A. a) i & ii
B. b) ii & iii
C. c) iii & i
D. d) i, ii & iii
Answer:

You are a highly capable assistant with expertise in law, ethics, and reasoning.
You are taking the Australian Bar Exam, which consists of multiple-choice questions.
Each question will have four options (A, B, C, D).
Read each question carefully, consider all options, and select the single most appropriate answer.
Provide your answer by stating the letter of your chosen option (A, B, C, or D).
Do not explain your reasoning unless specifically asked.
